dt: {bc}to shake or wave (something, such as a weapon) menacingly
{bc}to exhibit in an {d_link|ostentatious|ostentatious} or aggressive manner

pt: {sc}swing{/sc} {sc}wave{/sc} {sc}flourish{/sc} {sc}brandish{/sc} {sc}thrash{/sc} mean to wield or cause to move to and fro or up and down. {sc}swing{/sc} implies regular or uniform movement.
{sc}wave{/sc} usually implies smooth or continuous motion.

et: Middle English {it}braundisshen{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}brandiss-{/it}, stem of {it}brandir{/it}, from {it}brant, braund{/it} sword, of Germanic origin; akin to Old English {it}brand{/it}
shortdef: to shake or wave (something, such as a weapon) menacingly
to exhibit in an ostentatious or aggressive manner
